instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 2915 Demux'd but display looks like GPU issue
threads.message:
See images. This was Demux'd using Doslab's flashing of the GMUX. I've checked and tidied up the LVDS double checked connectivity there and made sure no pins are shorting together.  L9010/11 look good. Resisters around GMUX check out. Definitely looks like slightly bad or off connection somewhere. Any thoughts?

[ATTACH type="full"]59835[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full"]59836[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 2915 Demux'd but display looks like GPU issue
threads.message:
Did you flash with correct jed file?
Before reflashing GMUX, did you get boot menu image with good quality?

threads.title: 2915 Demux'd but display looks like GPU issue
threads.message: I have a few of these that I did all at once but I do think the image was good before I bypassed it because I debated leaving the GPU as it was. Try reflashing the GMUX then? I did check to see that the dedicated GPU does not show in system info...

threads.title: 2915 Demux'd but display looks like GPU issue
threads.message:
Redo GMUX flash and check the boot menu image.
Don't forget to solder back R8904/11 (which one was removed).

threads.title: 2915 Demux'd but display looks like GPU issue
threads.message: this was not board related. Either the cable/LCD went bad.
